intro: Agapetes odontocera var. stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled agapete, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant typically has small, elliptical leaves that are leathery and dark green in color. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, edible berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, often found in high-altitude regions with high humidity and cool temperatures.
